relation: Very safe campus, in a not so safe area.
There is not much to do for fun in Fitchburg, but it is what you make of it.
Food is okay but choices are very limited with only on dining hall.
Dorms are on the dirtier side, but very fun to live in. The only pitfall is maintenance.
I think that it is average, though it does fluctuate from professor to professor.
Take the time to talk to your professor and staff, they are all nice and actually helpful.
It is a nice school, only becoming nicer with all the renovations underway. It is an extremely small school, with only one dining hall. Overall it is a decent school, not too bad.
pageTitle: Fitchburg State University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {55143=Offering an unlimited dining option, students can eat as often as they want from 7:00 A.M until 7:00 P.M with great chefs from Chartwells. This option also includes an additional $125 to use towards on-campus eateries such as Subway, 2Mato, Cafe, and BYOB (Build your Own Burger)., 113417=Food at the new dining hall is getting better and better as local food buying has been a new interest of 2012-2013, 113960=Fitchburg State is a great school with a beautiful and growing campus well worth the cost of attending. Professors, students and administration are what truly make the school worthwhile especially for the low costs of attending. I recommend this school to any student looking to attend college in fall or 2013, 170989=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 112903=Fitchburg is a nice small size city just 5 minutes away from the Train to Boston. But you will always find somewhere to enjoy your time whether its a at a club at school event. The rave thrown this past March was really fun.}

textAfterTable: Bang for the buck Very affordable. Am enjoying being here Fun every day, the students who organize the activities here, or FAB, are great and get comedians, magicians, and bands along with all kinds of games where you can win some awesome prizes! Am learning a lot Classes are small and the professors are nice and really care about your success! Login to rate or flag the reviews Shannon from Blackstone, MA 07/07/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 4 out of 5 people found this review useful. 3 of 36 Categories Comments Great for these types of students I feel Fitchburg is great for all types of students. However, our most common majors include Nursing, Education, and Business, Criminal Justice and Film. I am personally involved in the Exercise Science program and I absolutely love it.
